list.definition: Muhammad's wife, a wealthy widow who ran a prosperous caravan business
Muhammad's father-in-law and early convert to Islam who became the first caliph
Muhammad's cousin and son-in-law who was assassinated after becoming the fourth caliph, trusted by Shi'ites
Umayyad prince who escaped the Abbasid massacre of his family and fled to Spain to establish a new Umayyad dynasty
Descendant of Muhammad's uncle who led a rebellion against the Umayyads and founded the Abbasid dynasty
Iraqi Ulama, Muslim theologian who established the basis for Islamic law. Said Hadith should be based off of Muhammad's teaching.
Muslim mathematician who pioneered the study of algebra
Muslim-Persian physician who wrote the Canon on Medicine
